alert.note: Alert for Indian River; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 2:22PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Indian River and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Saint Lucie, Fort Pierce, Vero Beach, Indian River Shores, Indrio, Fort Pierce Inlet, White City, Vero Beach South, Gifford, Fort Pierce North, Saint Lucie Airport, Saint Lucie Village, Fort Pierce South, Lakewood Park, Queens Cove, Vero Beach Highland, South Beach, Indian River Estates, Saint Lucie West and Port Saint Lucie River Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
